attributes.action: All UK televised football games to have the option of no commentary
attributes.additional_details:
It should be compulsory for football broadcasters to offer an option, perhaps by way of ‘the Red button’, where it’s just ambient crowd noise i.e. no commentary. 

This would allow people who get frustrated with football commentary to enjoy the atmosphere of the games and not feel the need to mute the entire audio signal.
attributes.background: More often that not, UK football commentators supplement the ambient crowd noise with a combination of statistics gleaned from Wikipedia and the identification of the player in possession of the ball - something the viewer can often manage simply by looking at the TV set.

rejection.details: This would be a decision for the broadcaster and not the UK Government or Parliament.
